ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: This course should be offered every Spring semester! It is essential for students who are focusing on Industrial Ecology, since Industrial Symbiosis is the area in which IE can be APPLIED!

This course was well-constructed, organized and engaging. Professors Chertow and Park made a good team.Some of the guest lectures were very dry and the readings were repetitive. The class periods could have been more engaging if there were activities or simulations (like the negotiation activity early on), rather than reading presentations. It would be more effective to have to apply the articles to a debate/simulation etc, rather than report back on what they were about.
It's an excellent, well-planned class especially for industrial ecology track students.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Jooyoung was extremely well-organized and both her lectures and the course overall were put together very well. This is all the more impressive since this was the first run of the course. Having Marian in the class and her experience and leadership in this field was a huge asset.
I liked sharing the reading discussion responsibilities with other students. It was great to hear their questions and reflections on readings to kick-start discussions.
Besides a very well planned an executed course work, the class included sections with most of the globally re-known practitioners in the discipline.
The term project was valuable and some of the lectures at the very beginning of the semester were fantastic.
The international perspective and carefully selected readings

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The class did have a very academic focus, and it may be more valuable to approach the material from policy and business perspectives as well. If more quantitative analysis and exercises could be incorporated, that may add value.
Time management! There's a lot of information to cram into the class time, and a 3-hour block is pretty brutal. I think breaking up the course time/meeting to twice per week would help a lot.

The lectures could be more interactive and the assignments more diverse. There would be more accountability if students knew they would need to complete the readings in order to participate in the class activities.

1.) more simulation/programming related addition (doesn't have to be within the class but some relevant information will be helpful); 2.) start to encourage people think about the final projects earlier during the semester.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: My focus is industrial ecology, so I feel it's very important to have the advanced class, even if the topic changes from time to time.
Although the disciple is highly undeveloped, in my working region, upon taking the class, I have the challenge of bringing the practice, and contribute to it's development
I'm interested in sustainable industrial systems, and as one IE tool used for building sustainability into industrial practices, industrial symbiosis was an important area to explore more deeply.
It's an excellent advanced level class that ties the knowledge I learned from previous IE classes together.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I'm interested in the subject and it will be useful for my career.
Interest in the material and the opportunity to take a course with Prof. Park.
It's an elective for my track and I've been wanting to learn industrial symbiosis systematically for a long time.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes.
Yes

For the most part. I was interested in the material, but would have enjoyed thinking more broadly and critically about IS, perhaps as a sustainable development tool or as a means of sparking economic development. We did some of this, but there could have been more in-depth discussion and critical thinking around these issues.
Absolutely. This is one of the best classes I've ever had at FES.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Because of working in a group, we had the opportunity to undertake a broader, more comprehensive project than would have been possible working alone.
It was helpful.

I did not have any problems working with a group in preparing reading discussions. However, my partner for the final paper did not contribute his fair share. He did not begin writing the paper until around 10PM the night before it was due. I had urged him since about a week ahead (with an outline) to prepare a draft of his parts, but he did not. I had to stay up with him for 12 hours straight to force him to finishwriting the paper as he kept dozing off all evening, which was a terrible experience for me (considering I finished my part ahead of time...). I was very unhappy with the final quality of the paper due to his lack of time management/willingness to prioritize this assignment. I believe I would have been better off writing the paper on my own.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: This is a reading- and writing-intensive course.
The course is more research oriented. If you want to gain more in-depth knowledge in terms of different aspects of Industrial ecology, then go for it.
I will highly recommend the class, if ever repeated
1.) make sure to do the readings before the lectures; 2.) start the final project early; 3.) practice before theclass presentations.
